str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I cause to increase, become greater (b) I increase, grow. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to grow, i.e. Enlarge.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
And, even, also, namely.
Knowledge, doctrine, wisdom. From ginosko; knowing, i.e. knowledge.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
And, even, also, namely.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
And, even, also, namely.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
And, even, also, namely.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.
